contentrichtext.text: {{Unreferenced stub|auto=yes|date=December 2009}} {|{{Infobox Ship Begin}} {{Infobox Ship Image |Ship image= |Ship caption= }} {{Infobox Ship Career |Hide header= |Ship country=UK |Ship flag=[[Image:British-Royal-Fleet-Auxiliary-Ensign.svg|60px|RFA Ensign]] |Ship name=RFA ''Sea Crusader'' |Ship namesake= |Ship owner= |Ship operator= |Ship registry= |Ship ordered=17 March 1995 |Ship awarded= |Ship builder=[[Kawasaki Heavy Industries]], [[Japan]] |Ship original cost= |Ship yard number= |Ship way number= |Ship laid down= 18 March 1996 |Ship launched= 7 June 1996 as '''Celestine''' |Ship sponsor= |Ship christened= |Ship completed= |Ship acquired= |Ship commissioned= 10 October 1996 and renamed '''Sea Crusader''' |Ship recommissioned= |Ship decommissioned= 7 August 2003 |Ship in service= |Ship out of service= |Ship renamed= |Ship reclassified= |Ship refit= |Ship struck= |Ship reinstated= |Ship homeport= |Ship identification= |Ship motto= |Ship nickname= |Ship honours= |Ship captured= |Ship fate= Returned to owners in 2003 and name reverted to '''Celestine''' |Ship status= |Ship notes= |Ship badge= }} {{Infobox Ship Characteristics |Hide header= |Header caption= |Ship class= |Ship type= [[Sealift]] |Ship displacement= 18,031 tonnes full load |Ship length= {{Convert|162.49|m|ftin|abbr=on}} |Ship beam= {{Convert|25.2|m|ftin|abbr=on}} |Ship height= |Ship draught= {{Convert|6.52|m|ftin|abbr=on}} |Ship depth= |Ship hold depth= |Ship decks= |Ship deck clearance= |Ship ramps= |Ship power= |Ship propulsion=2 Ã— 7 cyl Kawasaki MAN-B&W diesel engines |Ship sail plan= |Ship speed= {{Convert|18|kn|km/h}} |Ship range= |Ship endurance= |Ship boats= |Ship capacity= |Ship troops= |Ship complement=17 |Ship notes= }} |} '''RFA ''Sea Crusader'' (A96)''' was a fast [[sealift]] ship of the [[Royal Fleet Auxiliary]]. It is described by the RFA as a "Strategic Lift [[RORO|Ro-Ro]]". It was built by [[Kawasaki Heavy Industries]], [[Japan]] and entered service in 1996. In 1998 the charter was extended to cover until its replacement could be brought into service. {{DEFAULTSORT:Sea Crusader (A96)}} [[Category:Ships of the Royal Fleet Auxiliary]] [[Category:1996 ships]] {{UK-aux-ship-stub}}
